title: Album Page, "Louis XVI Bronze Work", April 6, 1888
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: 26; bottom right corner: 2; clockwise from center bottom edge: Louis XVI Bronze work - / Paris / April 6 - 1888; key hole - ; frame of medallion on writing desk of / Louis XVI; gilt bronze; Festoon on Vase; frosted bronze / wood; garland on leg of table.
description: Vertical sheet illustrating examples of bronze hardware found on vases, tables, and desks, all in the Louis XVI style.  At the top is a rose leaf festoon tied together with a ribbon in a soft cream color.  Below is a very large medallion framed by bow of laurel leaves and berries bound together at the top and a large golden yellow ribbon in imitation of gilt bronze above.  At bottom right are two bows of a garland, its floral elements stylized, all tied to a central medallion with two ribbons streaming out of it from either side.  Below left is an escutcheon in the shape of two crossed laurel branches tied with a neat bow at the base, which frames the key hole.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Louis XVI Bronze Work", April 6, 1888.Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-197.
